results.title: Randomized controlled trial: lisinopril reduces proteinuria, ammonia, and renal polypeptide tubular catabolism in patients with chronic allograft nephropathy.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Sodium_Bicarbonate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017693 @@@Sodium bicarbonate@@@ was given to all @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ to treat @<m>DISEASE_Acidosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000138 @@@metabolic acidosis@@@ prophylactically (@<m>DISEASE_Acidosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000138 @@@acidosis@@@ increases significantly with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@).

citations.NLM: Amara AB, Sharma A, Alexander JL, Alfirevic A, Mohiuddin A, Pirmohamed M, Close GL, Grime S, Maltby P, Shawki H, Heyworth S, Shenkin A, Smith L, Sharma AK, Hammad A, Rustom R. Randomized controlled trial: lisinopril reduces proteinuria, ammonia, and renal polypeptide tubular catabolism in patients with chronic allograft nephropathy. Transplantation. 2010 Jan 15;89(1):104-14. PMID: 20061926
citations.BibTeX: @article{20061926, title={Randomized controlled trial: lisinopril reduces proteinuria, ammonia, and renal polypeptide tubular catabolism in patients with chronic allograft nephropathy.}, author={Amara AB and Sharma A and Alexander JL and Alfirevic A and Mohiuddin A and Pirmohamed M and Close GL and Grime S and Maltby P and Shawki H and Heyworth S and Shenkin A and Smith L and Sharma AK and Hammad A and Rustom R}, journal={Transplantation}, volume={89}, number={1}, pages={104-14}}

results.title: Comparison of effects of angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibition with those of angiotensin II receptor antagonism on functional and metabolic recovery in postischemic working rat heart as studied by [31P] nuclear magnetic resonance.
results.text_hl: Significantly milder @<m>DISEASE_Acidosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000138 @@@acidosis@@@ during @DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischemia@@@ and significantly increased coronary flow were characteristic of the improved functional recovery exhibited by the groups treated with either @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ or @CHEMICAL_L_158338 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C083194 @@@L-158,338@@@ in vivo.

citations.NLM: Werrmann JG, Cohen SM. Comparison of effects of angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibition with those of angiotensin II receptor antagonism on functional and metabolic recovery in postischemic working rat heart as studied by [31P] nuclear magnetic resonance. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 1994 Oct;24(4):573-86. PMID: 7528840
